title: How to Charge a Power Bank

steps.title: Check the LED lights to see when your power bank needs charging.
steps.content: Check the LED lights to see when your power bank needs charging. While a power bank can be charged at any time, unnecessary charging may decrease its lifespan. Most power banks have 4 LED lights on the side. The lights will shut off as the battery diminishes. Wait to charge your power bank until only 1 or 2 lights are on. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Plug your power bank into a wall outlet if possible.
steps.content: Plug your power bank into a wall outlet if possible. Your power bank should have come with a USB cord and wall adapter. Plug the larger end of the USB cord into the wall adapter. Then, plug the smaller end into your power adapter. Leave the power bank to charge.

steps.title: Plug your power bank into a computer or laptop as an alternative.
steps.content: Plug your power bank into a computer or laptop as an alternative. A computer or laptop can also be used to charge a power bank. Connect the smaller end of the USB cord into the power bank. Then, connect the larger end of the USB cord into your computer or laptop's USB port . It will take longer to charge a power bank on a computer than it would with a wall charger.

steps.title: Check your manufacturer's instructions for an estimate of charging time.
steps.content: Check your manufacturer's instructions for an estimate of charging time. You should not leave your power bank charging longer than necessary. Your manufacturer's instructions should let you know roughly how long it will take to charge. Most power banks charge within 1-2 hours. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Disconnect the charger as soon as it's fully charged.
steps.content: Disconnect the charger as soon as it's fully charged. Check the charger periodically as it's plugged in. As soon as all the LED lights are on, unplug the charger. Your power bank’s lights may also blink on and off until it’s fully charged, at which point it the light will stay lit. [3] X Research source If your LED lights are not working , unplug the charger after the estimated charging time has passed.

steps.title: Check to make sure the power bank charged properly.
steps.content: Check to make sure the power bank charged properly. After charging your power bank, connect one of your electronic devices to the bank using a USB cord. If the power bank charged correctly, the device should begin charging. [4] X Research source If the device didn't charge, try plugging it into a different outlet. If your power bank still won't charge, it may be broken. Contact the manufacturer to see if it can be fixed.

steps.title: Use a wall socket in most cases.
steps.content: Use a wall socket in most cases. In general, wall sockets will charge a power bank faster than a computer or laptop. Stick to charging your power bank through the wall unless you only have a laptop or computer available. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use only the cable that came with the power bank to charge it.
steps.content: Use only the cable that came with the power bank to charge it. The power bank should come with a charging cable with a USB port and a wall adapter. Avoid using a different charging cable that was not designed for the power bank.

steps.title: Avoid overcharging your power bank.
steps.content: Avoid overcharging your power bank. Make sure not to leave your power bank plugged in for too long. Charging the bank for hours on end can cause its battery life to decrease. Only charge your power bank as long as necessary for the LED lights to stop blinking. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Charge your electronic device and power bank simultaneously.
steps.content: Charge your electronic device and power bank simultaneously. While your power bank is charging, plug in any electronic devices you typically charge with your power bank into a wall socket. Charging devices eats up a power bank's battery. If you charge your electronic devices at the same time, you won't have to use the power bank as quickly after it charges. This will increase its battery life.
